org.jtrim.image.async

Class SimpleUriImageLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.async.SimpleUriImageLink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncDataLink<ImageData>

    public final class SimpleUriImageLink
extends java.lang.Object
implements AsyncDataLink<ImageData>
    Defines an AsyncDataLink which is able to retrieve an image based on an URI. To actually retrieve the image file from the external source, the URL class is used, therefore SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve any image which the URL class can. To load the image, the ImageIO library of Java is used and therefore the meta data of the retrieved image is a JavaIIOMetaData.

    The SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve partially retrieved image and even the meta data without the image until the complete image is available.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    SimpleUriImageQuery

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleUriImageLink

        public SimpleUriImageLink(java.net.URI imageUri,
                  TaskExecutor executor,
                  long minUpdateTime)
        Creates the SimpleUriImageLink with the specified URI defining the image to be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        imageUri - the URI of the image to be retrieved. This argument cannot be null.
        executor - the executor used to actually retrieve the image. That is, the image is retrieved in a task submitted to this executor. This argument cannot be null.
        minUpdateTime - the minimum time in nanoseconds which must elapse between providing partially complete images to the AsyncDataListener. Note that to actually forward an image to the AsyncDataListener requires the BufferedImage to be copied (and while copying the loading of the image is suspended). Therefore providing an intermediate image is a considerable overhead, so it is important not to set this value too low. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if either the URI or the executor is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified minUpdateTime is less than zero

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public AsyncDataController getData(CancellationToken cancelToken,
                          AsyncDataListener<? super ImageData> dataListener)
        Starts retrieving the data which is linked to this AsyncDataLink. The data will be forwarded to the specified listener usually asynchronously on a separate thread. Note however that this method may also forward the data synchronously on the current thread to the listener if it is readily available and does not need some expensive operation to load.

        Once this method has been called successfully, the onDoneReceive method of the listener must be called eventually regardless what happens. Failing to call this method is a serious failure of the AsyncDataLink implementation.

        Implementation note: This method will submit a task to retrieve the image to the executor specified at construction time.

        Specified by:
        getData in interface AsyncDataLink<ImageData>
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken signaling if the data retrieval process need to be canceled. Implementations may ignore cancellation requests but they should cancel the data retrieval and call the onDoneReceive method of the listener, signaling that the data retrieval cannot be completed due to cancellation. This argument cannot be null.
        dataListener - the listener to which the data is to be forwarded. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the AsyncDataController which can be used to control the way it is being loaded and request the progress of the data retrieving process. This method must never return null.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this AsyncDataLink in no particular format

        This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
